text: On my last six pack from a case (over several weeks). Aroma is great with plenty of citrus. Smells great. Taste is OK however it doesnt quite live up to the promise of the aroma. Visually a clear amber fluid. Consistently no head retention which is disappointing. Sometimes it is the glass but after 18 cans into various hand washed and thoroughly rinsed glassware it is safe to say that it is the beer this time. Palate is a little thin, watery and overly carbonated - but only slightly on all those points. One of the better lower alcohol beers I have purchased.

From can in pint glass. Pours golden amber with wispy white head that dissipated quickly but body remained highly carbonated. Excellent hop aroma of citrus, apricot and maybe a hint of passionfruit. CO2 levels make for a lively palate with a hint of bitterness in the finish. A refreshing beer good for summer (or designated drivers).

330ml bottle into schooner glass. Cloudy amber beer with a huge white head. Nice fruity aroma with a whiff of malt. Light body. Creamy, fruity taste. Finish has pineapple, bitter lemon, mango, caramel. Great refreshing beer, irrespective of the ABV.

(Bottle) Clear golden amber with good white head. Lovely aroma - pine, citrus, hints of stone fruit. Light body, good carbonation. Taste is a little thin, but good for a mid strength. Tart fruity start with nice hoppiness from mid palate. Excellent mid strength beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber with a large head.
Nose shows hay, soft light malt, grassy notes and little else.
Flavours include honey, light grassy and spicy hops.

Draught as part of a paddle at Harts Pub on October 10, 2015.Clear straw yellow color, white head. Hoppy, bitter, floral, grainy taste. Slight metallic, bitter aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness. Hoppy, citrus, grainy, some cheese scent.

Decent head misty amber gold pour strong medium carbonation aromas citrus malt note flavours resin touch medium bitter biscuit citrus zest taste good clear strong tastes the finish nice hop and malt mix a good little pale ale for its size well made
A very citrus floral aroma with lots of flavour and a nice long palate. Loads of bitterness that hangs around. For a beer that is 2.8 ABV it has loads of flavour. Very drinkable!
For a low alcohol beer this packs a decent hoppy punch. If youre not limiting your Alcohol theres better stuff.
@FB rated as low alcohol beer, great beer..................find a better one @2.8%

Draught at Micro-brewery, Eagle Heights. Poured a slightly hazy golden amber colour with a 5mm foamy white head that retained well and laced OK. Carbonation low and fine. Aroma of citrus hops/grapefruit. Taste semi sweet with hoppy citrus/grapefruit. Light body. Crisp, clean, dry with a nice moderate lingering citric bitterness on the finish. Easy drinking. Very nice for a light beer.

On tap at Archive Beer Boutique 061214. Soft white foam clings to the edge of the glass. Well carbonated and apricot in colour this beer carries a fair bit of aroma and flavour for such a low alcohol beer. Definitely a beer that you could keep coming back to.
On tap at The Archive. Pours clear amber with a medium creamy head, laces well, plenty of hop flavour, great for a mid.
